content:
After finding the president did not collude with Russia, the special counsel is no longer Republicans’ bête noire

FOR 674 DAYS Robert Mueller, in his capacity as special counsel, conducted a comprehensive investigation into President Donald Trump’s campaign correspondence with Russian operatives ahead of the 2016 presidential election. On March 22nd that investigation ended. Two days later William Barr, the attorney general, reported that Mr Mueller had found no evidence that the president or his associates had directly conspired with any of the Russians who sought to influence the election in his favour. After two years of calling Mr Mueller’s investigation a “rigged witch hunt” and “total hoax”, Mr Trump immediately sought to bolster the special counsel’s credibility, saying that the report “could not have been better” and falsely claiming on Twitter that it grants him “TOTAL EXONERATION”. (In fact, according to Mr Barr’s letter, Mr Mueller did not reach a conclusion about whether the president had committed the crime of obstruction of justice.) Although Mr Trump’s flip-flop is hardly surprising, his supporters have played an impressively quick game of follow-the-leader.

A survey of 1,500 Americans conducted on The Economist ’s behalf by YouGov, a pollster, found in early March that among respondents who said they had voted for Mr Trump in 2016, 73% disapproved of Mr Mueller and just 11% approved of him. Now this group has made an about-turn. In the most recent survey from YouGov—conducted partially after the special counsel’s main findings were reported to Congress and made public—Mr Mueller remained unpopular, but by a much smaller margin of 52% disapproval to 32% approval.

In the past Mr Trump’s supporters have been quick to mirror whatever opinion the president adopts. A 2018 study by Michael Barber and Jeremy Pope, both of Brigham Young University, found that the probability that a Republican would adopt even a liberal policy view increased by more than 15 percentage points if they were told Mr Trump had endorsed it, too. It is no wonder that Republican voters have now followed the president’s lead to a warmer embrace of Mr Mueller. What is more surprising is that Democratic respondents, who are also susceptible to sharp changes in their opinions based on political circumstances, have not followed suit in the opposite direction. That may be in part because the party’s leaders and spokespeople have been careful not to criticise the special counsel, for whom they previously expressed profound respect.

Despite the good news for Mr Trump, his historically low approval rating remains largely unchanged. America’s voters do not appear to find Mr Mueller’s revelations to be as important as other considerations about his presidency, such as his efforts to weaken Barack Obama’s health-care law and lower taxes on corporations, that have influenced their opinions in the past. However, it is early days, and there is still plenty of time for voters to change their minds. The president may yet get a boost to his prospects of being re-elected next year.

到目前为止，没有人能够提出一个综合计划来告诉我们如何这样去做，但每一个人都同意这一计划的最大组成部分是什么。

ex: n. 不赞成；不喜欢

我们都害怕不赞同或者惩罚，但是这个虚拟的世界没有警察或者权威人物。
At this point, however, I’m optimistic that this initiative will also run aground on popular .
不过，在这一点上我比较乐观，因为这项动议在大众的反对声中同样也会搁浅。

vi. 不赞成；不喜欢

可是难以想象她会不满意你。
But if it does so, it will now be tough to argue that gay sex should be banned because many Indians  of it.

I really disapprove this decision.
我反对这个决定。

Allow me to get the standard disclaimer out of the way, which is that, in fairness to other treatments of my work, I cannot endorse any of them, including this one.
请允许我先发表一个免责声明，即为了公平起见，对于所有针对我作品的评论，我不会发表任何赞同与否的意见，也包括对这本书。

ex: vt. 愚弄；欺骗

悍马去年销量下降51%——是整个行业中最糟糕的表现——而今年又令人难忘地惨跌67%左右。

更让人惊奇的是，当无人使用时这种纸手机不会消耗电量。

至于内容，我可以告诉你们，普遍来说，苏黎世人民对待这次改革都采取了自由主义的态度。

ex: n. 梗阻；阻塞；障碍；障碍物

他因妨碍警察执行公务而被逮捕。

对工厂大门的堵塞

这辆被遗弃的汽车堵住了道路。
It is my job to make sure that all pathways are clear of obstructions.
保证所有的道路通畅是我的职责。

If you ignore the return status of functions, you may miss when they fail or partially succeed.
如果您忽略函数的返回状态，当它们失败或部分成功的时候，您也许会迷失。

wp.profound relationship: 深厚的关系;深刻的关系

ex: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

那篇文章的含义很深。
He conceived a profound hatred for his enemies.
他对敌人有刻骨的仇恨。
And what is belief? It is a profound belief related to what you want to achieve.
那么什么是信念呢?它是一种和你想完成的事情有关的意义深远的信仰。

ex: n. 前途；预期；景色
vi. 勘探，找矿
vt. 勘探，勘察
eg2: But with no signs of any precipitation, the  of the harvest looks bleak.
但是由于没有任何降水的迹象，收获的前景看起来很渺茫。
I continue to hold out the  that they may decide to walk through this door.
奥巴马说：“我继续抱着这样一个希望，即他们可能决定跨过这道门。
If people possess altruistic motives, then they sometimes act to benefit others without the  of gain to themselves.
如果人们具有利他的动机，则他们有时会做有利他人的事，而不期望自己获得利益。

eg2: startling/sensational revelations about her private life
对她的私生活令人吃惊的揭露
The company's financial problems followed the revelation of a major fraud scandal.

ex: adj. 易受影响的；易感动的；容许…的
n. 易得病的人
eg2: Like it or not, your attitude is  to the dominate attitude of those around you.
不管你愿不愿意，人总是很容易受周围态度的影响。
While not all implementations of DNS are subject to this kind of attack, many real-world sites are completely .
虽然并非所有 DNS 实现都会受到这类攻击，但现实世界的许多站点都是非常脆弱的。
We need to ask why the bees are more  to these viruses.
那么我们就要问，为什么蜜蜂会更容易感染这些病毒？

ex: adj. 未改变的

wp.remain unchanged: 保持不变;维持不变;保持没变;保持原状

eg2: All the examples in book use the core syntax, which we expect to remain unchanged going forward.
在书中所有例子所使用的这些核心语法，我们希望将来都会保持不变。
By passing the interesting information to the endpoint inside a document, you can leave the endpoint definition  across both major and minor upgrades to either side of the conversation.
通过将有趣的端点信息传送到一个文档内，您可以在通信双方任意一方主要升级和次要升级过程中保持端点定义不变。
Once tests have been targeted to cover only changed function, any results from unchanged areas of code may then be carried forward from one build to the next.
一旦确定了测试的目标是只覆盖变更的功能，那么来自于未变更代码区域的结果就可能从一次构建转移到下一次。

Title: Robert Mueller is more popular with Trump voters than he has ever been

paperStatistics.title: Robert Mueller is more popular with Trump voters than he has ever been
paperStatistics.desc: After finding the president did not collude with Russia, the special counsel is no longer Republicans’ bête noire
